Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Staple-Line Reinforcement in Pulmonary Resection

Participants.evidence: 48 patients aged >20 years undergoing thoracoscopic lobectomy for suspected lung malignancies at Kobe University Graduate School of Medicine

Intervention.evidence: new staple-line reinforcement (SLR) device in pulmonary resection

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a new staple-line reinforcement (SLR) device in pulmonary resection.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was air leakage from the staple line during the intraoperative water sealing test.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The incidence of intraoperative air leakage from the staple line was 6.3% (3/48). Compared to historical controls, the SLR group had a significantly lower incidence of air leakage (6.3% vs. 28.5%, P < 0.001)

Harms.evidence: No malfunctions of the SLR or stapling device were observed. Prolonged air leakage occurred in two patients (4.2%), with one requiring reoperation.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was registered in the Japan registry of clinical trials (jRCT1052220008).
